greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 5*Lucas(n).
comment: After 5, the sequence provides the 3rd column of the rectangular array in A213590.
After 5, all terms belong to A191921 because a(n) = Lucas(n+4) - 3*Lucas(n-1).
a(n) mod 3 yields (1,2,0,2,2,1,0,1), repeated, and is given as A082115.
link: Bruno Berselli, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,1).
formula: a(n) = Fibonacci(n+5) + Fibonacci(n-5), with Fibonacci(-i) = -(-1)^i*Fibonacci(i) for the negative indices.
program: a = A280154(); print([next(a) for _ in range(39)]) # _Peter Luschny_, Dec 29 2016
xref: Cf. sequences with formula Fibonacci(n+k) + Fibonacci(n-k): A006355 (k=0, without the initial 1), A000032 (k=1), A022086 (k=2), A022112 (k=3, with an initial 4), A022090 (k=4), this sequence (k=5), A022352 (k=6).
results.author: _Bruno Berselli_, Dec 27 2016
